channel.title: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?
channel.description:
I recently been making more happier, energetic, cheerful tracks, But my Track Cover/logo doesn't go with the mood.So I sketch a person named Mitchi. She is already sketch out and later be illustrated on a computer or tablet(haven't made my mind on it yet). Let me know if it's a good idea or if you have anything else that may be better please let me know
![20180226_095922|281x500](upload://15zDCIINnwbqVe565E3so87sgyk.jpg)

item.title: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?
item.dc:creator: Devoid-of-joy
item.description:
It’s not a career for me, I’m a barber. But it’s been a passion and compulsory. I am gearing towards a convention this summer so I’ve been behind on music making.

item.title: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
MusicMakingMarco:

Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?

MusicMakingMarco:

But my Track Cover doesn’t go with the mood.

Just to clarify, are we talking about your logo or cover art?

item.source: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?

item.title: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?
item.dc:creator: MusicMakingMarco
item.description:
That’s an advice I been hearing often, So what if I draw the gal and add her a pink mask? The mask is somewhat a logo of my songs and will allow me to make new drawing if I Feel like a new one is necessary like
Or
Similar to the pink mask, the mask’s color changes depending on the genre of the track for example Techno is blue, piano is orange ect ect
But there now way I’m letting the guy in the black hoodie were a pink mask so the Girl will swap that role with him

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?

item.title: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
Your tracks would lack consistency (at least visually) so I would not do this.

Instead, I would use one logo for all of your tracks and vary the background of the album art somehow. Maybe use different colors for different “moods” of your tracks, or different kinds of masks on your logo, or something along those lines.

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?

item.title: Is making a logo for each type of genre a good idea?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
I don’t think that’s a good idea.

Your logo is a big part of your brand.
You can’t just change your brand just because you change genres.

Read full topic
